RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Rac es Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOREVER TAKES TIME exchanged light contact with He's On The Line leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, angled to the outside entering the stretch and dug in to get up the final yards. CHARITABLE WINDSOR exchanged light contact with He's On The Line leaving the gate then gave chase, improved in the four path on the turn, dueled for the lead mid-stretch but was outfinished in the final yards. ABENDEGO dueled with a slim lead leaving the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested even terms at the rail on the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. JEFFERSON SECURITY gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. ELEANORS JACK pressured the pace three wide through the backstretch, contested even terms two deep on the turn but weakened nearing mid-stretch. HE'S ON THE LINE came away awkwardly and was jostled leaving the gate, contested with a slim lead the opening three sixteenths of a mile, gave chase from the three eighths pole but steadied between horses in the vicinity of the five sixteenths pole and weakened at the rail on the turn. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Abendego
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled from start,even terms rail turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Forever Takes Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed break,chased,3p turn,angled out 1/8,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: He's On the Line
ENTRY.OWNER: Sperling Nancie S and Racanelli Mark Joseph

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAPPY BAYTOWN took over and set a pressured pace nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept sharp through the stretch. MIDCENTURY MODERN chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and cleared second in an even finish. RAGAZZA MIA chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and finished evenly to take third late yards. KAPADOKYA pressured the early pace but dropped back leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and flattened the final sixteenth. P B FOXY gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. FUZZY WUZZY chased, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. BAYTOWN RINGER came away a step slow and appeared sluggish.

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Ringer
ENTRY.OWNER: McEntee Racing Inc Winfrey Donald S and Resolute Racing Alliance LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Baytown
ENTRY.OWNER: Baytown Partnership and Resolute Racing Alliance LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCHMEAR settled in the three path the first turn then gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, took the nod three wide midway on the far turn and dug in under determined handling to inch clear the final yards. SEIZE THE BREEZE rated the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Country Charlie leaving the half mile pole and put that one away approaching the five sixteenths, was met at the rail midway on the far turn but dug in gamely to deep stretch before ceding; reluctantly. PERSONAL FINANCE came away a bit awkwardly then settled in the three path the first turn and stalked into the backstretch, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep while between horses on the far turn, but flattened leaving the eighth pole. SURF CITY GOLD came away awkwardly then saved ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened in the lane. COUNTRY CHARLIE stalked off the rail then challenged leaving the half mile pole, dropped back toward the five sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the far turn. LOVE MACHINE rounded the opening turn in the five path and never factored. MISS YOU AJAX raced in the four path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. STILL THE ONE was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Seize the Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,dueled from 1/2,met rail mid turn,reluctantly ceded

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Miss You Ajax
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HUEY DUEY took a quick lead and rated the pace while tapering in, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and held on under steady handling. FROGGY THE GREMLIN gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and finished evenly at the winners outside flank. CAJUN FUN chased outside through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and came along to take third inside the sixteenth pole. DOC ELM gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. SKY OF GOLD saved ground. BIG BALLOONS chased inside and faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy

ENTRY.NAME: Huey Duey
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 19, 2022. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 19, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARKETABILITY was shuffled back at the start and settled off the rail on the opening turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily progressed, rounded the far turn near the rail and dug in to take over later yards. WAGER WORTHY took a slim lead at the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to show the way, was met at the nine sixteenths pole but recovered the advantage past the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second while outfinished for the win. ADABEL raced off the rail on the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, contested the far turn two deep and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. WOODSONG'S CASTLE saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and ran evenly down the lane. LIGHTFOOT MISS raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, ran in the four path on the far turn and showed little further. SO RED THE ROSE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, ran in the four path on the far turn and passed some rivals in the lane. CONNOISSEUR raced with the pace two deep and took the nod at the nine sixteenths pole, dueled through the backstretch but faded off the rail on the far turn. DANCE LIGHTLY saved ground on the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. MISS BETTE LUTE ducked in leaving the gate and raced in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, ran wide on the far turn and was eased in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Marketability
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled early,off rail,bid 7/16,rail turn,dug in lane,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Bette Lute
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in break,3p 1st turn,chased 7/16,wide far turn,eased

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 13200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 19, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CASTLE OF CAYLEE stalked off the rail, gave chase past the half mile pole and took the lead in the three path approaching the head of the lane, raced clear into the stretch and held on under steady handling. CICI UNIFIED raced in the five path early on then saved ground, picked up the chase past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out into the lane, dueled clear for second mid-stretch and was gaining on the winner. URKILLINGMEBETH rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then flattened stride the final sixteenth. ONEPRETTYTHING rated the pace inside, was met into the backstretch and dueled close to the mid point of the far turn, but dropped back toward the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. MISS WILD came away awkwardly then stalked from the three path, challenged and kept the edge over Oneprettything from the half mile pole, but was met at the rail nearing the eighth pole and weakened. CHINA CAT was not a factor while saving ground. UPSY DAISY DO raced off the rail early, left the second turn outside and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Castle of Caylee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 1/2,up 3p near 1/8,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Urkillingmebeth
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PHANTOM QUEEN took a quick lead and set a pressured pace, contested the edge off the rail on the turn and dug in under steady handling to widen later yards. GHOST OF ALCINA gave distant early chase, raced at the rail through the turn and gained steadily to take second later yards. XTENDED STREAK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, steadied toward mid-stretch but came back to duel for third. ESSENTIAL MAGIC chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, eased to the four path leaving the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. LIL BOUGIE pressured the pace and raced close at the rail on the turn, but flattened stride inside the eighth pole. OUR GREAT NOTION chased outside, raced five wide on the turn and flattened in the lane. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS gave chase, ran in the five path on the turn and weakened in the lane. LAURA'S GRAND was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Essential Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Ghost of Alcina
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant early chase,rail turn,steady lane gain,2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Phantom Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge off rail turn,dug in lane,widened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 48. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROAD PUNCH gave chase, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, dug in under steady handling and got up the final strides. RAISE A RUCKUS pressured the pace between horses and took the nod past the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling but was caught in the final strides. DOG TOWN ALLEN pressured the pace, raced close two deep on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LORD CLANCY engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn, was carried out entering the stretch and finished evenly outside. J. WICK pressured the early pace inside, steadied at the rail nearing the quarter pole and flattened stride in the lane. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path, entered the stretch outside and showed little more. MYLASHURRAH steadied at the start then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little more. NEEDNOEXPLANATION was hustled along with the early pace but faded in the four path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Road Punch
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,3& 4p turn,dug in lane,up final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Raise a Ruckus
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod past 3/8,edge rail turn,nipped final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Lord Clancy
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase outside,5p turn,carried out 1/8,evenly lane
